• What you need to know:

    • Learn more about actions you can take Link: https://frac.org/covid-19-actions to urge the Senate to swiftly take action and boost SNAP benefits in the next COVID-19 relief package, including elevating this letter Link: https://frac.org/wp-content/uploads/FINAL-Senate-Letter_18June2020.pdf signed by nearly 2,500 organizations Link: https://frac.org/news/2500-organizations-urge-senate-to-invest-in-critical-federal-nutrition-programs .
    • On May 15, the House passed the HEROES Act (H.R. 6800) Link: https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/6800?s=1&r=48 with a vote of 208-199 Link: http://clerk.house.gov/evs/2020/roll109.xml . The bill now moves to the Senate. Urge the Senate and the Administration to enact a COVID-19 recovery package that continues to provide nutrition and other needed assistance to struggling individuals and families. Check out FRAC’s statement Link: https://frac.org/news/frac-commends-snap-and-child-nutrition-and-broad-stimulus-provisions-in-latest-covid19-recovery-package , FRAC’s analysis Link: /wp-content/uploads/FRACs-Analysis-of-House-C4-HEROES-Act.pdf , and the section-by-section summary Link: https://appropriations.house.gov/sites/democrats.appropriations.house.gov/files/documents/Heroes%20Act%20Summary.pdf from the House.
    • Looking for information on Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT)? All the updates are on our P-EBT webpag Link: https://frac.org/pebt e.

    Share this image Link: https://www.dropbox.com/s/uqgmc3lby6ck8gq/SNAP%20asks%20phase%203.png?dl=0 on social media to urge advocates to take action!

    New Tools You Can Use

  • Community Eligibility Report

    The key to hunger-free schools during the 2019-2020 school year. Link: https://frac.org/research/resource-library/community-eligibility-the-key-to-hunger-free-schools-school-year-2019-2020

    • P-EBT FAQ

    SNAP

    FRAC Resources Pandemic EBT FAQ Link: https://frac.org/pebt Learn more about Pandemic
  • EBT eligibility and states' implementation. Link: https://frac.org/pebt

  • Pandemic EBT: A Critical Opportunity for States

    This resource provides information on the P-EBT program and helpful information for implementation, including resources. Link: https://frac.org/research/resource-library/pandemic-ebt

  • Webinar Recording: CACFP during COVID-19

    Learn about new flexibilities designed to support CACFP providers, programs, and sponsors in the current COVID-19 public health emergency. Link: https://frac.freestonelms.com/viewer/daZTRe44gTJnF47tWHrhJoMGnWfLymi3AEUcF8dpD1SiG

  • COVID-19 Child Nutrition Guidance and Meal Sites by State

    This map includes links to each state agency’s website that provides details on how to serve meals during school closures. Other resources include links or maps to meals sites, depending on availability. Link: https://frac.org/research/resource-library/state-websites-and-meal-lists-maps

  • CACFP Update: Families First Act

    FRAC’s update summarizing the Families First Act’s changes to Child and Adult Care Food Program waivers. Link: https://frac.org/research/resource-library/cacfp-update-families-first-act

    • Summary of USDA's Nationwide Nutrition Waivers in Response to COVID-19

    Electronic Benefit Transfer eligibility and states’ implementation of this program.

    Why the Administration and Congress Need to Build on SNAP Down Payments Now Link: https://frac.org/blog/why-the-administration-and-congress-need-to-build-on-snap-down-payments-now
    FRAC Chat blog clarifying the USDA’s emergency benefit announcement and FRAC’s congressional ask for the SNAP 15 percent boost to maximum allotments.

    Pandemic EBT Link: /research/resource-library/pandemic-ebt
    Guidance from FRAC that summarizes and offers considerations for implementing Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT).     The Families First Coronavirus Response Act gives the USDA the authority to issue nationwide waivers to ensure access to meals through the child nutrition programs as communities respond to COVID-19. Link: https://frac.org/research/resource-library/nationwide-waivers

  • Maximizing WIC’s Role in Supporting Health, Food Security, and Safety During the COVID-19 Pandemic

    Actions that WIC, advocates, partner organizations, and state and local policymakers can take to help preserve access to WIC during this pandemic. Link: https://frac.org/wp-content/uploads/wic-role-during-covid-19-pandemic.pdf

  • Summary of USDA's Nationwide Child Nutrition Waivers in Response to COVID-19

    Q&As from the USDA on the logistics of delivering meals through the Summer Food Service Program (SFSP) and the Seamless Summer Option (SSO) while using existing authority. Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/sfsp/covid-19-meal-delivery

  • Summary of School Districts and Program Providers’ Efforts to Serve Meals During School Closings

    An spreadsheet compiled by FRAC of school districts serving meals and broken down by state, district, and model. Link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18r1lKXwrDxExJ0dG7mqHuRrY7Nxk7SihBIqo84zLzsY/edit#gid=0

creates the P-EBT program, an important opportunity to provide nutritional resources to families who are losing access to free or reduced-price school meals as school across the country close in response to COVID-19.

An Advocate’s Guide to the Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (D-SNAP) Link: https://frac.org/research/resource-library/advocates-guide-disaster-supplemental-nutrition-assistance-program-d-snap
Learn how D-SNAP works and what advocates, elected officials, and service providers can do to reduce hunger and food insecurity before, during, and after a disaster.

USDA Waivers

State-by-State SNAP Waivers Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/disaster/pandemic/covid-19/snap-waivers-flexibilities

SNAP Emergency Allotments to Current SNAP Households Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/disaster/pandemic/snap-emergency-allotments
The USDA grants states waivers to issue SNAP emergency allotments bringing households’ benefit amounts up to the maximum benefit for their household size.

USDA blanket approval for states to adjust SNAP interview requirements Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/snap/snap-adjusting-interview-requirements-due-novel-coronavirus-covid-19-blanket-approval

USDA Guidance

Month-to-Month Continuation of Emergency SNAP benefits Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/snap/covid-19-emergency-allotments-guidance

SNAP COVID-19 Emergency Allotments Guidance Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/resource/snap-covid-19-emergency-allotments-guidance
Guidance from the USDA Food and Nutrition Service (FNS) regarding SNAP state agencies on implementing emergency SNAP allotments pursuant to H.R. 6201

USDA FNS Memorandum SNAP Questions and Answers, COVID-19, Set #1 Link: https://fns-prod.azureedge.net/sites/default/files/resource-files/SNAP-COVID-QA1.pdf

State-by-state list of SNAP EBT contractors (March 2020) Link: https://fns-prod.azureedge.net/sites/default/files/resource-files/ebt-status-report-state.pdf

SNAP Guidance on Time Limits for Recipients Currently Enrolled Link: https://fns-prod.azureedge.net/sites/default/files/resource-files/FFCRA-Impact-on-ABAWD-TimeLimit.pdf
Guidance from the USDA Food and Nutrition Service (FNS) regarding SNAP state agencies on current status of SNAP time limits pursuant to H.R. 6201

SNAP Pandemic Planning Guidelines Link: https://fns-prod.azureedge.net/sites/default/files/media/file/SNAP-Pandemic-Planning.pdf
Learn how State agencies can work within their agency and with State-level pandemic planning authorities to update their pandemic plans.

Online Purchasing

Online Purchasing Pilot Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/snap/online-purchasing-pilot approved states: AL, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, MA, MD, MI, MN, MO, MS, NH, NJ, NM, NC, NE, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI
The online purchasing pilot initially began in AL, FL, IA, NE, NY, OR, WA Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/snap/online-purchasing-pilot . Arizona and California Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/04/08/arizona-and-california-added-innovative-snap-online-pilot-program were approved April 8. Florida and Idaho Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/04/11/florida-and-idaho-added-innovative-snap-online-pilot-program were approved April 11. District of Columbia., and North Carolina Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/news-item/usda-022020 were approved April 17. Kentucky, Missouri, and Texas Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/news-item/usda-022520 were approved April 21. Vermont Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/04/24/vermont-added-innovative-snap-online-pilot-program was approved April 24. Minnesota Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/05/01/usda-approves-minnesota-accept-snap-benefits-online was approved May 1. Nevada Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/05/04/usda-approves-nevada-accept-snap-benefits-online was approved May 4. Colorado Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/news-item/usda-0224520 was approved May 6. New Mexico Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/news-item/usda-25020 was approved May 7. Rhode Island Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/05/08/usda-approves-rhode-island-accept-snap-benefits-online was approved May 8. Wisconsin Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/05/11/usda-approves-wisconsin-accept-snap-benefits-online was approved May 11. Connecticut, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, Tennessee and Virginia Link: https://www.fns.usda.gov/news-item/usda-026820 were approved May 20. New Hampshire Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/06/03/usda-approves-new-hampshire-accept-snap-benefits-online was approved June 3. South Dakota Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/06/05/usda-approves-south-dakota-accept-snap-benefits-online was approved June 5. Delaware Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/06/05/usda-approves-south-dakota-accept-snap-benefits-online and Mississippi Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/06/10/usda-approves-mississippi-accept-snap-benefits-online were approved June 10. South Carolina and Utah Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/06/16/usda-approves-south-carolina-and-utah-accept-snap-benefits-online were approved June 16. Kansas Link: https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2020/06/23/usda-approves-kansas-accept-snap-benefits-online was approved June 23.

FMI — The Food Industry Association Blog Post: It’s A “SNAP” To Order Online and Pay At Store Link: https://www.fmi.org/blog/view/fmi-blog/2020/03/17/it's-a-snap-to-order-online-and-pay-at-store
FMI — The Food Industry Association blog regarding “click, collect and pay” options for grocery access for SNAP shoppers.

Letters From FRAC and Partners

May 28 letter Link: https://foodpolicyalliance.org/app/uploads/2020/05/sfpa-covid-19-nutrition-programs-letter-final.pdf from the Sustainable Food Policy Alliance (SFPA), including Danone North America, Mars Incorporated, Nestlé USA, and Unilever United States, urging Congressional leadership to provide a temporary increase in SNAP benefits in the next coronavirus relief legislation, along with other measures that would boost nutrition-related resources.

Utilizing Restaurants to Get Food to SNAP Participants Link: /wp-content/uploads/NCCR-FRAC-NRA-WCLP-IFDA-Letter-to-USDA-Sec-Perdue-re-SNAP-RMP-040720.pdf
A letter to USDA Secretary Perdue asking him to promote the Restaurant Meals Program so people are aware they can use their TANF and SNAP EBT funds through this program. The letter is signed by FRAC, the International Foodservice Distributors Association, the National Council of Chain Restaurants, the National Restaurant Associate, and the Western Center on Law & Poverty.

AARP Letter Link: https://www.aarp.org/content/dam/aarp/politics/advocacy/2020/04/04082020-aarp-letter-to-congress-on-covid-19v20-final2.pdf
A letter to Congress from the AARP asking to strengthen Federal Nutrition Programs among other programs in response to COVID-19.

Letters from Federal and State Policymakers

July 1 letter Link: https://fudge.house.gov/press-statements/fudge-lee-katko-lead-161-members-in-urging-leadership-to-increase-food-assistance-benefits-during-the-covid19-pandemic/ from Reps. Marcia L. Fudge (OH), Barbara Lee (CA), and John Katko (NY) delivered a letter to Congressional leaders urging an increase in Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) to address rising food insecurity and unprecedented demand at food banks across the country.

June 1 letter Link: https://oag.ca.gov/system/files/attachments/press-docs/HEROES-Act-Letter-SNAP-Rules.pdf from 25 state attorneys general urging Congress to include provisions in the next coronavirus stimulus package that would prohibit the use of funds to finalize or implement three administrative rules that would restrict Americans’ ability to receive critically necessary SNAP benefits.

May 6 letter Link: https://www.vanhollen.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/LETTER_Leadership%20on%20MD%20Delegation%20SNAP-Nutrition%20Priorities%205.4.20.pdf from Maryland delegation in support of SNAP in the next COVID-19 relief package.

May 5 letter Link: https://www.vanhollen.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/LETTER_Leadership%20on%20MD%20Delegation%20SNAP-Nutrition%20Priorities%205.4.20.pdf from Wisconsin Senator Baldwin, Congresswoman Moore, Congressman Kind, and Congressman Pocan in support of SNAP in the next COVID-19 relief package.

April 29 letter Link: https://www.merkley.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/Final%20SNAP%20C4%20Letter.pdf from 22 Senators led by Democratic Senators Merkely (OR) and Murphy (CT) urging Senate leaders to boost SNAP benefits.

April 28 letter Link: https://panetta.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-panetta-senator-murphy-announce-legislation-expand-access from Congressman Panetta, Senator Murphy announce legislation to expand access to Restaurant Meals Program amid COVID-19.

April 27 letter Link: https://www.murphy.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/murphy-hirono-harris-warren-to-usda-college-students-need-access-to-snap-during-pandemic from Senators Murphy (D-CT), Hirono (D-HI), Harris (D-CA) and Warren (D-MA) urging USDA to allow college students unemployed due to COVID-19 access to SNAP.

April 21 letter Link: https://www.nga.org/policy-communications/letters-nga/governors-letter-regarding-covid-19-aid-request/ from bipartisan National Governors Association calling for 15 percent increase to maximum SNAP benefit and other relief.

April 16, a letter Link: https://www.booker.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/NJ%20Delegation%20Letter%20re%20SNAP%20during%20COVID.pdf from two Senators and nine Representatives from New Jersey asking Congressional leaders to bolster SNAP benefits as a legislative priority.

April 16 letter Link: https://www.bennet.senate.gov/public/_cache/files/3/4/3459daf6-d84f-418d-b6c2-e92cb261961a/03FB1743C16077F9708434DCCD16485D.gardner-bennet-polis---letter-to-mcconnell-and-schumer---covid-19-response-colorado-priorities.pdf from Colorado Governor Jared Polis (D) and Senators Michael Bennet (D) and Cory Gardner (R) wrote their own on how increasing SNAP benefits will help their state.

April 13, joint statement Link: https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/41320 from House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer that included boosting SNAP as an urgent priority in an interim emergency coronavirus relief package. This follows their joint statement on April 8 Link: https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/4820 , which listed a “15 percent increase to the maximum SNAP benefit to help put food on the table” among the top priorities.

April 9 Congressional Progressive Caucus wrote a letter Link: https://cpc-grijalva.house.gov/uploads/2020.04.09_CARES2%20CPC%20Priorities.pdf to Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi detailing their priorities for the fourth Congressional relief package, including strengthening SNAP.

April 6 House letter Link: https://fudge.house.gov/uploads/2020-04-06%20SNAP%20during%20COVID%2019%20HOUSEWIDE%20WITH%20SIGNATURES.pdf led Reps. Jim McGovern (D-MA), Marcia Fudge (D-OH), Rosa DeLauro (D-CT) and Ayanna Pressley (D-MA) and signed by 136 of their colleagues urging House and Senate leaders to prioritize anti-hunger efforts and strengthen SNAP in the next COVID-19 legislative relief package.
